Abstract:
The &RCWA; Package provides methods for computations with the so-called Residue Class-Wise Affine mappings (rcwa mappings for short) and the groups generated by bijective mappings of this type.
The rcwa mappings are a type of mappings of certain euclidian rings R into themselves, e.g. the integers form an example for a possible ring R. The bijective rcwa mappings of R form a proper subgroup of Sym(R) which might be conjectured to be simple. In general, the computation with arbitrary mappings from \mathbb{Z}Z into \mathbb{Z}Z is an algorithmically difficult task. The rcwa mappings provide a class of mappings which are accessible to computations.
The rcwa groups can be finite or infinite and they form a class of subgroups of Sym(R). Their investigation is the central aim of this package.
